intro: Knautia arvensis subsp. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf knautia, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its long, slender leaves and upright growth habit make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
